title: Narnia's Prince Caspian font
content:
Hello guys,  
I need your help to identify this Small Caps font that is used on the movie poster for the new installment in the Chronicles Of Narnia series.  
Thanks in advance for any help!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605022009im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/princecaspian_6480.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Chanel logo - custom designed {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605022009/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37622 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Ultra-fat seventies style Didone "Chop Shop" - Stilla {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605022009/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37654 "Go to next forum topic")
author: n-joy

comments.content:
The closest I could find was [Faust Small Caps,](http://web.archive.org/web/20080605022009/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=RRT0010036) but it’s not an exact match.

- Lex

Thank you, Lex.  
Faust has a few similarities to the specimen I posted, but misses the peculiarities I was really looking for (the spikey serifs, the R swash) that give this font its “medieval fantasy” flavour.  
Any other hints?

I know, Paul.  
You may be right: I can’t remember having ever done such an extensive research with absolutely no results.  
So I guess this can be a custom drawn shape or a modification on a simpler typeface, even if it seems to me an excessive effort to obtain such a simple result.  
However, I think I’ll stop searching...
